intro: Psychotria microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a small, smooth, orange-red capsule that contains several seeds. Psychotria microcarpa is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and is part of the diverse flora in these ecosystems.
